title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. Start with the given equation:
3x² $$=$$ $$12x$$ + $$63$$

$$2$$. Bring all terms to one side to set the equation to zero:
3x² - $$12x$$ - $$63$$ $$=$$ $$0$$

$$3$$. Factor out the common factor 3:
3(x² - $$4x$$ - 21) $$=$$ $$0$$

$$4$$. Divide both sides by 3:
x² - $$4x$$ - $$21$$ $$=$$ $$0$$

$$5$$. Factor the quadratic expression:
The product of the two numbers must be $$-21$$, and their sum must be $$-4$$.
...
